III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/28/2023 during a safety check, Staff 1 knocked on Youth
A's door. She told him to wait a minute because she was
changing. Another staff member was on shift and heard Youth A
tell Staff 1 not to enter. Staff 1 opened the door anyway, stood in
the doorway, and stared at Youth A in a creepy way while she
dressed. Staff 1 eventually exited the room and shut the door
behind him. Youth A did not immediately report the incident. She
reported the incident on 11/08/2023. After the incident, Youth A
felt uncomfortable around Staff 1. He seemed to be following her
around and hanging around her more often.
Investigation Complainant/Supervisor was interviewed via phone on
11/14/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being informed of the allegations by Staff 3 who was told by Youth
A on 11/8/23. At that time, Complainant/Supervisor made a
recipient rights complaint and Recipient Rights began an
investigation. Today (11/14/23) Complainant/Supervisor was
informed by Administrator 1 that the allegations would need to be
reported to MDHHS because of the information learned during
interviews. Recipient Rights has not interviewed Staff 1 at this
time. She also reported on the day of the allegations being
reported (11/8/23), Staff 1 was removed from working with youth
at the facility. 11/7/23 was the last day Staff 1 worked at the facility
before being suspended with a plan that Staff 1 will not be
returning to the facility. She reported informing Staff 1 of the
allegations and the investigation by Recipient Rights and Staff 1
replied with “not surprised Youth A would embellish the report”.
Complainant/Supervisor also reported being Staff 1’s direct
supervisor. Staff 1 has worked at the facility for the past month to
month and a half. Staff have reported Staff 1 has been
disrespectful towards co-workers, engaging in nonhealthy
relationships with youth, ordering youth to do things rather than
asking, and playing loud and disrespectful music during working
hours. Complainant/Supervisor just received these complaints
around the time she received the allegations from Staff 3.
Complainant/Supervisor was interviewed again face to face at
the facility on 11/20/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
She reported staff are trained to knock before entering a youth’s
bedroom, but it is not stated in any facility policy that staff have to
2

knock. She also reported Staff 1 was written up for not completing
room checks appropriately following the incident.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/16/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported understanding the reason for the interview and believes
Staff 1 is weird because Staff 1 stares at the youth in the program.
Youth A reported Staff 1 has told the youth in the program, Staff 1
is 18 and this is Staff 1’s first job. Youth A reported the incident
occurred on a weekend and began when Staff 2 asked Youth A to
help make the dinner. Youth A went to Youth A’s bedroom to
change when Staff 1 knocked on Youth A’s door. Youth A
reported to have yelled “hold on” and Staff 1 opened the door and
stood staring for a minute at Youth A before slowly stepping out of
the room and closing the door. Youth A reported being in the
process of changing clothing and having pants on. Youth A was in
the process of putting Youth A’s bra on and only needed to pull
the straps of the bra into place. Youth A was unable to recall if any
private parts were showing but Youth A believed something could
have been showing. Youth A believed Staff 1 said “oops, I’m
sorry” in a sarcastic manner. Youth A didn’t say anything to Staff 1
at the time but later when coming across Staff 1 in the milieu,
Youth A swore at Staff 1. Youth A was asked about feeling safe at
the facility, and Youth A reported Staff 1 makes Youth A feel
unsafe.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/20/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported Youth A told
her about the incident in Youth A’s bedroom with Staff 1 but could
not recall the date. Staff 2 was in the kitchen and Staff 1 was
conducting room checks when she heard Youth A yell “just hold
on”. Staff 2 remembered asking Youth A to help with dinner and
Youth A went to her room to change. After being told of the
incident by Youth A, Staff 2 “watched” Staff 1 the rest of the shift.
Staff 2 reported speaking to Staff 1 after speaking to Youth A.
Youth A had informed Staff 2 that Staff 1 had shut the door slowly
in a creepy manner while staring at Youth A. Staff 1 told Staff 2,
Staff 1 had made a mistake by not knocking on the bedroom door,
but informed Staff 2 of the same story of the incident with the
exception of shutting the door quickly and looking away. Staff 2
also reported Youth B had to yell at Staff 1 to shut the door the
next day after the incident with Youth A. Staff 2 asked Youth B if
Staff 1 knocked on the door before opening it and she believed
Youth B said Youth B didn’t hear a knock. Youth B reported being
undressed at the time. Staff 2 reported speaking to Staff 1 about
ensuring that he knocks on the door before opening it and she
3

was unable to recall Staff 1’s response. Staff 2 also reported not
informing anyone else of the incidents and was unable to identify
why she didn’t take any action. Staff 2 admitted that she doesn’t
knock on the door when doing room checks and was unsure if
there is a policy stating the need to knock each time.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/20/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being told
by Youth A on 11/9/23 Staff 1 was doing room checks and walked
into Youth A’s room when she was “naked”. Staff 1 is reported to
have “looked Youth A up and down before slowly leaving” and
closing the bedroom door. Later, Staff 3 reported Youth A said
Youth A was in the middle of getting Youth A’s bra on but didn’t
say if Youth A had anything else on. Staff 3 also reported being
told by Youth C that Youth C overheard Youth A tell Staff 1 to
stop. Youth A is reported to sleep naked, and the program is
working on helping Youth A to wear something when sleeping. It is
unknown if Staff 1 knew of Youth A sleeping naked because he
was a new employee. Staff 3 reported staff are to knock on the
door before entering a youth’s room and this is taught by
Administrator 1 during trainings. Staff 3 believed policy states staff
have to knock but she was unable to identify the written policy.
Staff 3 informed Therapist as soon as Staff 2 informed her of the
incident and Staff 2 filed a Recipient Rights.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/20/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 reported staff are
to knock on the youth’s door before entering the room and if the
youth wants staff to wait a minute to enter, male staff are to
engage female staff to enter the room. If there are no female staff
present, male staff are to let the youth know staff have to
complete a check and then enter the room to complete the check
by knocking and opening the door.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/20/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported Youth A told
him about the incident with Staff 1. Youth A told Staff 5, Staff 1
was standing in the doorway to Youth A’s room while doing a
room check and lingered there, making Youth A feel
uncomfortable. Staff 5 reported he will knock on a youth’s room
door and wait a couple of seconds before entering the room. If the
youth says wait a minute, Staff 5 will wait a couple more seconds
and then tell the youth he needs to do the check. Staff 5 viewed
Staff 1 as a good staff who was following the rules, but the youth
in the program had no respect for because of his young age.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/20/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported being aware
of the allegations and not working since 11/7/2023. Staff 1
reported telling Staff 2 about the incident. Staff 1 open the door
during a safety check on Youth A. Staff 1 observed Youth A’s face
and noticed Youth A was not totally clothed. When it registered,
Staff 1 started closing the door and told Youth A, he was sorry.
There was no delay in Staff 1 leaving the room. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was wearing a “crop top tank top with straps and
sweatpants”. Staff 1 believed the incident occurred before 4:30
pm. Staff 1 also reported since working at the facility, he has
noticed other staff not knocking on youth’s doors when doing room
checks and being told by staff (unable to identify) that knocking
gives youth time to hide items in their room so you should not
knock. Staff 1 was trained to knock on the youth’s door and the
bathroom door when checking on a youth. When shadowing third
shift staff, the staff don’t knock on the door before entering the
room. Staff 1 reported during his initial training he questioned why
knocking was not in the manual but was unable to recall the
response. Staff 1 also reported avoiding Youth A after the incident
to give her space, however, Youth A was rude and often
interrupted Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/29/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B
reported not being present during the incident. Youth B reported
having knowledge of Staff 1 and described Staff 1 as giving off
“weird vibes” because he would talk about his age and work
experience. Staff 1 told Youth B, his job was to supervise and
watch the youths’ behaviors. Staff 1 would also act childish
(unable to give an example) and would play inappropriate music
loud. When Staff 1 came into Youth B’s room for a room check,
Staff 1 told Youth B he was coming into the room for a safety
check and Youth B told Staff 1 to “get the fuck out of my room”.
Youth B was asked about staff doing room checks and Youth B
reported staff will knock when checking on a youth in the
bathroom and staff (unable to identify specific staff) told Youth B
they do not have to knock when checking on youth in their rooms.
Youth B also reported being told by Administrator 1 that staff don’t
have to knock when checking youth in a bedroom. Youth B then
reported staff do knock on the bedroom door and ask if the youth
is descent before opening the door to the room. Youth B feels safe
at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/29/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
5

reported being down the hall in the kitchen when she heard Youth
A scream. Youth C began to walk back towards her room (across
the hall from Youth A) when she observed Staff 1 standing in the
doorway of Youth A’s room holding the door open. Staff 1 was
staring and looking Youth A up and down while standing in the
doorway for about 15 to 30 seconds. Youth A was standing in the
bedroom putting on a bra, but Youth C was unsure if Youth A was
wearing pants or not. Youth C also reported about 15 seconds
later, Youth A came out of her room and down the hall yelling and
screaming while saying Staff 1 was a pervert. Youth A also said
Staff 1 didn’t wait after Youth A told him to wait a second before
coming into the room. Youth A continued to talk about the incident
through the evening and Staff 1 denied the allegations. Youth C
described Staff 1 as having limited experience in conducting room
checks and will linger in the room during the check. Staff 1 just
walks into the room and stands there while other staff just stick
their heads in the door to make visible contact with the youth.
Youth C reported being told by Staff 2 and Therapist that staff are
to knock when doing room checks or checking on a youth in the
bathroom. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed face to
face at the facility on 11/29/23 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Administrator 1 reported training staff to knock before
entering a youth’s room with the exception of 3rd shift. She also
reported clarifying this training during their last team meeting. Staff
are to knock for dignity and respect of the youth’s space and if the
youth tells staff to wait a minute, staff are to wait for the estimated
time it would take to put pants and a shirt on. Administrator 1 also
reported staff are to measure the time it takes them to put on
clothes then give the youth the same amount of time. The gender
of staff doesn’t matter when doing room checks and no matter the
gender, staff are to knock and if not hearing anything, they are to
open the door. Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 both reported
there is no written policy covering the process of doing room
checks.
Documents Reviewed:
Michigan Department of Community Health Recipient Rights
Complaint dated 11/10/23 and completed by Staff 3. This
document outlines the incident as reported by Youth A. Staff 1
walked into Youth A’s room when she was naked and stood in the
doorway looking at “her body up and down for several seconds”
before leaving the room. Youth B reported to staff, that Youth B
overheard Youth A tell Staff 1 not to enter because Youth A was
6

changing. It is documented Youth A reported Staff 1 opened the
door to Youth A’s room immediately and observed her “naked
body”. This document indicates Staff 1 would be removed from the
working schedule and not allowed to return to the facility until the
investigation was completed. Other staff reported Staff 1 was
“very harsh and talking down” to the youth in the program. Another
issue identified is that Staff 1 attended the same high school the
youth attend last year before graduating in the spring. Staff 3 is
reported to have been told, Staff 1 became upset when
transporting Youth C because he had forgotten Youth C’s
medication and had to return to the facility.
Pine Rest Interview Notes 11/13/23. This document has the
information gathered from the recipient rights investigation at the
facility. The specific staff interviewed include, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff
5, Supervisor, and Youth A. Each of these individual are
documented as providing similar information as given during each
of their interviews for this investigation. Additional information
provided included, Staff 3 documenting Staff 1 failure to knock on
Youth A’s door when Staff 1 had attended a recent training on
safety checks. Staff 5 noted, Staff 1’s age and perceived lack of
maturity might pose challenges to the role of staff at the facility.
Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Maple South
Resident Safety & Supervision Policy dated 11/2023. This
document was developed to provide a safe supportive, and
trauma informed environment for youth in care. The procedure for
youth safety checks is document and involve variable interval
safety checks at of minimum of every fifteen minutes. These
checks are to be completed more frequently if staff believe it is
warranted based on the youth’s behaviors.
Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Standard
Operation Procedures: Maple South - Resident Safety checks
08/2022. This document outlines the procedure for conducting
safety checks on youth. Each shift a specific staff is assigned the
duty of conducting safety room checks. These checks are to be
completed at a minimum of 15 minutes and in accordance with the
clinical practices/behavior plans. Staff are to check for breath and
body when observing the youth. If the youth is in the bathroom,
then a staff of the same gender should knock on the door, indicate
it is time for the safety check and place eyes on the youth. If the
youth is sleeping, then staff must make eye contact with body and
make sure they are safe. It is documented that if safety checks are
handed off to another staff the specific staff designed at the
beginning of the shift will inform the staff being passed the check
7

of the time of the last check. The staff taking on the checks will
verify the time by checking the safety check sheet.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was
hired on 8/14/23 and completed orientation on 9/29/23.
Documentation indicates Staff 1 completed the “Procedure for
Resident Safety Checks” and his final clinical training on 9/29/23.
Staff 1 completed his first “shadow Shift 1 (Self-Discipline)” on
8/29/23 and his “Shadow Shift 2 (Respect)” on 9/8/23.
Documentation indicates Staff 1 completed “Shadow Shift 3
(integrity) on 9/12/23 and “Assist Shift 1 (Achieve)” on 9/19/23.
Staff 1 completed “Assist Shift 2 (Excellence)” on 9/16/23. There
is a “corrective action notice” in the file dated 11/10/23. It is
documented Staff 1 violated Group II rule 5: Staff members are
required to engage in practices which promote safety to others.
This is the first offense. The offense involved Staff 1 documenting
a safety check at 1715 and not conducting another safety check
until 1840 which is beyond the variable interval of at least every 15
minutes. The corrective action involves Staff 1 reviewing the
“Safety Checks Procedure”.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation the agency is
found in compliance. Interviews were inconsistent on when or if
staff are to knock on youth’s doors or wait for a period of time prior
to entering and there is no agency policy to provide clarification.
Staff 1 knocked on the door and opened to Youth A in a state of
undress. After several seconds he closed the door. There is no
evidence that he acted inappropriate at that time.
Technical Assistance:
It was recommended that the facility develop a written policy and
clarification of knocking on the door for a safety check. Because
staff and youth alike reported some staff knock and others do not.
It was recommended that the hiring process be updated to ensure
staff are of an appropriate maturity level to work with the youth
served.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
